channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Canada Could Use a New Approach to Dealing With Trump This Time
item.description: While Canadian lawmakers are publicly sanguine about the incoming U.S. administration, several experts say that Canada faces significant challenges.

item.title: For Putin, Trump’s Win Is a New Opening, and a Chance to Win the War
item.description: Russians close to the Kremlin voiced optimism that Donald J. Trump could help end the war in Ukraine on Russia’s terms. But Moscow also remembers Trum...

item.title: Xi Jinping tells Trump that U.S. and China must ‘get along’
item.description: Both Trump and his Democratic rival Kamala Harris had pledged to get tougher on Beijing, but Trump upped the ante, vowing to slap 60% tariffs on all C...

item.title: Trump’s election victory means ‘his criminal problems have gone away,’ former federal prosecutor says
item.description: Legal experts say it's a matter of when, not if, Trump’s remaining criminal indictments are dismissed or postponed indefinitely.

item.title: Democrats Begin the Blame Game, and What Happens to Trump’s Legal Woes
Kamala Harris Was the Establishment in an Anti-Establishment Election
item.description: It was the wrong time to be the defender and champion of the country’s governing establishment.

item.title: Nissan Cuts 9,000 Jobs and Slashes C.E.O.’s Pay in Half
item.description: The Japanese automaker is carving deep cuts in its global operations as it struggles with a steep drop in sales.

item.title: For Putin, Trump’s Win Is a New Opening, and a Chance to Win the War
item.description: Russians close to the Kremlin voiced optimism that Donald J. Trump could help end the war in Ukraine on Russia’s terms. But Moscow also remembers Trum...

item.title: Germany’s chancellor under pressure to call early no-confidence vote as coalition government collapses
item.description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz said he would call a no-confidence vote next year, but opponents want it called next week.

item.title: Keir Starmer hopes U.S. special relationship will ‘prosper’, but Britain has many reasons to fear a Trump comeback
item.description: Trump's tariff plans could halve U.K. economic growth in the next two years, pushing up prices and interest rates.

item.title: China Braces for a New Era of U.S. Rivalry With Trump’s Return
item.description: Beijing is expecting more volatility and competition with the United States, though a lackluster economy may limit China’s options for pushing back.

item.title: Trump Will Test European Solidarity on NATO, Ukraine and Trade
item.description: Another Trump term could spur Europe’s efforts to stand on its own, but it is far from clear its leaders will seize the moment this time.

item.title: Trump Will Test European Solidarity on NATO, Ukraine and Trade
item.description: Another Trump term could spur Europe’s efforts to stand on its own, but it is far from clear its leaders will seize the moment this time.

item.title: BMW boss says Trump tariffs may actually give automaker ‘an advantage’ amid China wipeout
item.description: BMW has "a big footprint in the U.S. for the U.S., its CEO Oliver Zipse said as he played down fears of a trade war between Trump and Europe.

item.title: Netanyahu Faces Backlash for Firing Israel’s Defense Minister
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s dismissal of Yoav Gallant was seen as a risky step as Israel fights wars on two fronts. Opposition leaders said th...
